title: Pacific Drifters & Myth Road
subTitle: 太平洋漂鳥與神話之旅：台11線海線
intro: Focusing on marine landscapes and the free-spirited atmosphere loved by international travelers. Experience the 'Drifters' art culture in Dulan and the geological wonders of the coast.
transportation: Car rental or **Taiwan Tourist Shuttle (East Coast Line)** is recommended.

spots.name: Jialulan & Fushan (加路蘭遊憩區 & 富山護魚區)
spots.description: Admire driftwood art installations at Jialulan, then walk on the sea path at Fushan to observe wild fish up close.

spots.name: Dulan Sugar Factory (新東糖廠文化園區)
spots.description: The center of the 'Drifters' culture. This indigenous sacred ground turned art hub features the 'Sintung Sugar Factory' and the famous 'Dulan Small House' for burgers.

spots.name: Sanxiantai (三仙台)
spots.description: Originally a cape, now an offshore island due to erosion. Walking across the eight-arch bridge offers a lesson in plate tectonics.

spots.name: Donghe Old Street (東河舊街)
spots.description: Grab a famous 'Donghe Bun' (steamed bun) and admire the entrance to the Taiyuan Valley.

title: Valley Rice Waves & Tea Aroma
subTitle: 縱谷稻浪與茶鄉漫遊：台9線山線
intro: Enter the rift valley between the Central Mountain Range and the Coastal Mountain Range to experience extreme agricultural aesthetics and tranquility.
transportation: Rent a car or take a train to **Chishang** and rent an E-bike.

spots.name: Brown Boulevard & Paradise Road (池上伯朗大道)
spots.description: Famous for the 'Takeshi Kaneshiro Tree' and the community's consensus to have zero utility poles, creating an uninterrupted view of rice paddies.

spots.name: Chishang Rice Box Museum (池上飯包文化故事館)
spots.description: Taste the authentic Chishang rice box and learn about the history of rice farming in this region.

spots.name: Luye Highland (鹿野高台)
spots.description: An alluvial fan uplifted by tectonic plates. Perfect for grass sliding or paragliding, offering a panoramic view of the Beinan River valley.

title: Urban History & Indigenous Flavors
subTitle: 都會文史與部落美食：市區深度行
intro: Solves transportation pain points by focusing on the city center. Combines historical architecture with top-tier indigenous fine dining.

spots.name: Taitung White House (台東小白屋)
spots.description: A miracle of architecture built by a veteran over 40 years using scavenged materials without steel bars. Resembles 'Howl's Moving Castle'.

spots.name: Tiehua Music Village (鐵花新聚落)
spots.description: The core of Taitung's slow nightlife. Visit the 'Wave Building' which symbolizes the Pacific waves.

spots.name: Museum of Prehistory (國立臺灣史前文化博物館)
spots.description: One of the best museums in Taiwan, showcasing the rich prehistoric culture of the island.

spots.name: South-Link Blue Train (南迴藍皮解憂號)
spots.description: Take a vintage train ride to Taimali to see the 'Slam Dunk' railway crossing and the azure coast.

title: Mountains, Sea & Hot Springs
subTitle: 山海雙享與溫泉療癒：知本+縱谷
intro: Combines the magnificence of the Rift Valley with the relaxation of Zhiben Hot Springs.

spots.name: Guanshan Bike Trail (關山環鎮自行車道)
spots.description: Taiwan's first town-encircling bike path. Explore the Japanese-grid style town layout and the old train station.

spots.name: Zhiben Hot Spring (知本溫泉)
spots.description: Enjoy the sodium bicarbonate springs, known as 'Beauty Soup', to relax your muscles.

spots.name: Zhiben National Forest Recreation Area (知本國家森林遊樂區)
spots.description: Take a forest bath among giant White Banyan trees, observing the tropical monsoon rainforest vegetation.

title: The Great Yuchang Loop
subTitle: 玉長公路大環線：山海全覽
intro: Use the Yuchang Highway (Hwy 30) to connect the mountain and sea lines, seeing two distinct landscapes in one trip without backtracking.
transportation: **Car Rental** is essential for this route.

spots.name: Dulan & Donghe (都蘭 & 東河)
spots.description: Wander north along the Pacific. Stop at Dulan for its exotic vibe and Donghe to watch surfers.

spots.name: Yuchang Highway (玉長公路)
spots.description: A strategic road cutting through the Coastal Mountain Range. Experience the dramatic change in climate and vegetation as you exit the tunnel.

spots.name: Luanshan Tribe (鸞山部落)
spots.description: Reservation required. Visit the 'Walking Trees' (White Banyan) and learn the wisdom of the Bunun tribe's coexistence with the forest.

title: Surfing, Art & Tribal Secrets
subTitle: 極限探索與藝術文化：數位遊牧行
intro: Designed for young travelers and digital nomads. Focuses on surfing, paleolithic history, and the vibrant local art scene.

spots.name: Jinzun Recreation Area (金樽遊憩區)
spots.description: A world-class surfing venue. Watch the waves or grab a coffee at 'Moonlight Inn' nearby for a stunning sea view.

spots.name: Baxian Cave (八仙洞)
spots.description: Explore sea caves that house the 'Changbin Culture', the oldest known Paleolithic site in Taiwan.

spots.name: Taitung Art Museum (台東美術館)
spots.description: Wind down with an art walk in the city and hunt for treasures at the Tiehua Music Village before heading home.

title: Offshore Island: Green Island (Ludao)
subTitle: 綠島：火燒島的歷史與海底溫泉
intro: A volcanic island famous for its world-class saltwater hot springs and coral reefs. Explore the history of the White Terror era and dive into the crystal-clear Pacific Ocean.
transportation: **Ferry** from Fugang Harbor (50 mins) or **Plane** (15 mins). Renting a **Scooter** or **E-bike** is essential on the island.

spots.name: National Human Rights Museum (國家人權博物館)
spots.description: Visit the former Oasis Villa and New Life Correction Center. A solemn place to learn about Taiwan's martial law history and the fight for human rights.

spots.name: Zhaori Hot Spring (朝日溫泉)
spots.description: One of only three saltwater hot springs in the world. Soaking in the warm pools right next to the ocean while watching the sunrise or stargazing is a must-do.

spots.name: Chaikou Snorkeling Area (柴口浮潛區)
spots.description: Walking on the stone walkway extending into the sea feels like walking on water. The underwater world here is rich with coral reefs and friendly sea turtles.

title: Offshore Island: Orchid Island (Lanyu)
subTitle: 蘭嶼：達悟族飛魚文化與地下屋
intro: Home to the Tao (Yami) people, the only oceanic indigenous tribe in Taiwan. Experience the unique semi-underground houses, flying fish culture, and the pure 'Lanyu Blue' ocean.
transportation: **Ferry** from Fugang Harbor/Houbihu or **Plane** from Taitung. **Scooter rental** is highly recommended.

spots.name: Dongqing Bay (東清灣)
spots.description: The best spot for sunrise in Taiwan. Admire the beautifully carved traditional Tatala boats (canoes) resting on the beach. (Please do not touch the boats without permission).

spots.name: Ivalino Tribe Underground Houses (野銀地下屋)
spots.description: The best-preserved traditional settlement. Join a guided tour to enter a semi-underground house and learn how the Tao people adapted to typhoons.

spots.name: Lanyu Weather Station (蘭嶼氣象站)
spots.description: Located at a high altitude, it offers a breathtaking 360-degree view of the island's coastline and the surrounding Pacific Ocean. The white ruins add a nostalgic touch.
